0_to_90_days: Enroll in an advanced course on network architecture design (e.g., Coursera, Udemy) within the next month.
Participate in a project at Microsoft that involves high-level network design to gain practical experience within the next 3 months.
Attend a workshop or training session on Cisco technologies and enterprise routing switching within the next 2 months.
Shadow a senior network engineer during a large-scale network implementation project to observe and learn best practices within the next 3 months.
Attend a training session on creating effective technical solution proposals within the next 2 months.
Collaborate with the sales or pre-sales team to assist in drafting technical proposals for clients within the next 3 months.
90_to_180_days: Seek mentorship from a senior network architect at Microsoft to understand leadership roles and responsibilities within the next 3 months.
Lead a small team on a network design project to develop leadership skills within the next 6 months.

targetPerson: Rahul Jadhav (System and Network Engineer, Microsoft)
executiveSummary:
Rahul Jadhav, a System and Network Engineer at Microsoft, has been identified as having significant skill gaps in key areas of network engineering. Positioned in the lower-left quadrant, Rahul shows limited depth in both execution and development, indicating substantial room for growth. The primary gaps are in Network Design & Planning and Network Implementation & Support, each with a gap of 66.7%. Additionally, there are notable deficiencies in Network Architecture Leadership and Technical Solution Proposal, each with a gap of 33.3%.

To address these gaps, it is critical for Rahul to focus on developing skills in network architecture design and leadership, which are essential for staying competitive in his field. Other important areas for upskilling include expertise in Cisco technologies, enterprise routing and switching, and large-scale network design. By targeting these areas, Rahul can significantly enhance his capabilities and performance, aligning more closely with industry standards and improving his overall effectiveness as a System and Network Engineer.

quadrantPlotDescription:
Scatter plot with X-axis = "Network Architecture & Implementation" (0-10) and Y-axis = "Cloud Engineering & System Integration" (0-10).
Draw a vertical dashed line at X = 5 and a horizontal dashed line at Y = 5 to create four quadrants:
  • Upper-Right (X≥5, Y≥5): Strong on both dimensions — well-rounded.
  • Upper-Left  (X<5, Y≥5): Strong Y-axis breadth, weaker X-axis depth.
  • Lower-Right (X≥5, Y<5): Strong X-axis depth, lighter Y-axis execution.
  • Lower-Left  (X<5, Y<5): Developing on both — largest growth opportunity.

Plotted points:
  ★ Rahul Jadhav (System and Network Engineer, Microsoft) → (0.0, 3.3) [Lower-Left]
  ● Ha Duc Binh (Presales Consulting, Network Manager, Hewlett ..., Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE)) → (4.4, 2.2) [Lower-Left]
  ● Prince Sarkodie (System Engineer at Amazon Web Services (AWS), Amazon Web Services (AWS)) → (0.0, 0.0) [Lower-Left]
  ● Zhichun Roy Jiang (Network Architect at Alibaba Cloud - 领英, Alibaba Cloud) → (4.4, 0.0) [Lower-Left]

Target positioning rationale: Limited X-axis depth — development opportunity. Y-axis execution lighter — room to grow.
